Title:
The phylogenetic position of an Armillaria species from Amami
Island, in subtropical Japan, based on elongation factor and ITS
sequences
Keywords:
Armillaria novae-zelandiae  Elongation factor 
phylogenetic analysis, ITS
Abstract:
An undetermined Armillaria species was collected on Amami
Island, a subtropical island of Japan. The phylogenetic position of the
Armillaria sp. was determined using sequences of elongation factor-1α
(EF-1α) gene and the internal transcribed spacer (ITS) region
(ITS1-5.8S-ITS2) of rDNA. The phylogenetic tree based on EF-1α and ITS
sequences showed that this species differs from known Japanese
Armillaria spp. The sequences of this species were part of a strongly
supported clade that contained A. novae-zelandiae from Southeast Asia,
and part of a well-supported sister clade that contained A.
novae-zelandiae from Australia and New Zealand.
